intro: Echium africanum, commonly known as the African fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which includes other plants with similar medicinal and ornamental uses. Echium africanum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
